@How Dull Of course, there is also sexual material with only scenes of suffering (gore for example). But they are for a very fetishist / unpopular audience.

@How Dull It's entertaining (sexually) when those elements of reality like rape / kidnapping are turned into fiction. For example, a girl who is the victim of constant rape who is finally <broken> (broken mind) and whose story ends with her smiling (making the peace sign) in a gangbang while everyone (men) cumming in her body. That becomes entertaining because fiction eliminates suffering. Everything is pleasure in the end. That ingredient sells. And hentai writers know it.

@Ubuntu ghh NTR is popular for the fantasy of <conquering> someone else's wife, no matter how impossible. In real life there are cucks, but not cases like these where the wife <breaks down> because she is constantly raped, and finally ,she is only <happy> having sex with other men. On the contrary, human trafficking (rape, blackmail, prostitution) is a shitty hell for the victim.
